definition: broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: It was filled with eggs, some already broken open.
sentences.chinese: 它是蛋組成的，一些已經破開了。

sentences.english: I had to break into a $20 to pay the bus fare.
sentences.chinese: 我只好破開一張20美元的鈔票買車票。

sentences.english: We looked into a dusty room with a hole in the ceiling where once the stovepipe exited.
sentences.chinese: 我們走進一個髒暗的房間那裏天花板都破開了一個洞。

sentences.english: A spectator can even opt to remove the fog of war altogether for a truly global view of the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 從一個旁觀者的身份，可以破開任何一處的戰爭迷霧。

sentences.english: Later they break open the pods to remove the beans.
sentences.chinese: 然後破開豆莢取出可可豆。

sentences.english: I lose my key. The truck had to be broken open.
sentences.chinese: 我丟了鑰匙，只得把衣箱破開。

sentences.english: The chick finally broke through the shell and struggled out of it.
sentences.chinese: 小雞終於破開蛋殼，掙扎着從中鑽了出來。

sentences.english: The pipe broke open and water gushed everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 管道破開，水噴的到處都是。

sentences.english: The faster we get her stomach untwisted, the better.
sentences.chinese: 我們把她的胃破開得最快越好。

sentences.english: If you can read this page, that spells you have breeched the block.
sentences.chinese: 如果你可以正常瀏覽本頁面，說明已經破開封鎖。

sentences.english: Linda broke off some of the chocolate to give to the children.
sentences.chinese: 琳達把這塊巧克力破開，分了一些給孩子們。

sentences.english: The operator-splitting method is a numerical method.
sentences.chinese: 破開算子法是一種數值計算方法。

sentences.english: Could you change me a one-pound note, please?
sentences.chinese: 我們的乘客中沒有一個能破開這張鈔票的。

sentences.english: I’d like to have the one-hundred yuan bill broken up.
Maybe the front desk can break it for me.
